review:
Ever since running the recent update none of my photos backed up are shown within the app. It says that everything is backed up but all that is shown is empty frames. I have restarted my device, checked my internet connection and all routine things, I have even tried to re-download some photos but it tells me they‚Äôre already downloaded even though I can‚Äôt see them. Thank goodness I also use google photos otherwise it seems I would not be able to recover my pictures. Clearly there is a bug with this update that needs fixing
UPDATE MAY 2021
Thankfully the bugs are fixed and everything seems to be good. I still use alternative clouds ‚Äòjust in case‚Äô
title: No photos displayed since updating

review:
This App has really changed the way I use my phone. I have always suffered with limited phone storage so would hold off taking photos where I normally would, with the app it automatically uploads your photo library, then picks any new media when opening the app afterwards. I can then go back and delete my older photos on my phone to create free space, as the app has unlimited photo storage with Prime membership. It also has a desktop version which I‚Äôve been able to upload my older photos from other phones and also a camera I own creating a centralised photo album of all of my photos ever.

The only issues with the app is it doesn‚Äôt have any way to sort or filter on albums, with places, dates, people, scenery etc which would be very useful as a search tool. Also having a limited storage 5GB space for video is also annoying, as it fills up much more quickly than you‚Äôd realise.
title: Versatile App and Free with Prime

review:
Cannot fault this. You can filter by day-week-month-year. The face recognition is incredible and you can choose pics by person, perfect for a birthday or anniversary. It also filters places, so you can do a montage for where you have visited. I love the ‚Äúon this day‚Äù prompt -
It not only allows you to see memories but is also a reminder to back up from the last time you backed up. I do this daily now and it takes no time at all.  
I have full faith in knowing that if my phone is ever lost, all my pics and videos are safe.
title: Perfect backup

review:
On the photo side of things I can‚Äôt fault this app at all. I love the way it automatically uploads old pics with the date actually taken and on the odd occasion this doesn‚Äôt work you can change this. 
It downloads Live Photo‚Äôs from your iPhone and you can edit in the app. To top it off the memories from previous years is just genius ‚ù§Ô∏è 
The only reason I haven‚Äôt given 5 stars is the video side of things - 5gb really isn‚Äôt much, I would happily pay to increase just the video capacity however this doesn‚Äôt appear to be an option and as a prime member I already have unlimited photos, I‚Äôm not willing or able to pay even more to increase the whole app.
title: Fabulous app

review: Does the job, but the UI leaves a lot to be desired on the iPad. The interface feels like an oversized mobile app, with large buttons hidden behind swipe menus. Some functions do not make sense; for example, to upload pictures to an album, you must first exit the albums view, tap an options menu, select the pictures to upload. After the upload is complete, you then have to go back to the albums view, tap the button to create a new album, select the same pictures again and only then can you actually create an album. There are also no keyboard shortcuts and the app cannot run side-by-side with other apps.
title: Works, but poor interface

review: I have had the app the whole time I have had this phone, and I have never been disappointed with it. I have got a few albums on it, one of them is a progress record for the ongoing leg ulcer problem that I have had for a few years now. Some people think it's a bit strange, but, as I have had 2 keyhole surgeries, my surgeon said that they wished more people had a similar idea, as it gives them a better idea of the progress, and they have got more of an idea of what's going on! Brilliant! Just brilliant!! üëèüëèüëè
title: Love this app

review:
Since the redesign you no longer have access to the family vault. Instead, you have to move onto a web browser. 
Part of the reason this app was better to manage photos over Apple iCloud photos is the ability to have multiple people add photos which could be viewed/downloaded with ease as it was quick and easy to see who uploaded what to the vault. With that missing from the app there is very little point to it other than to view photos you, and you alone, have taken.
Best thing would be to reinstate this feature and it was one of the best things about the app.
title: Change isn‚Äôt always a good thing

review:
Update - Nov 2017

Updated to 5* as not only have we now got editing features, but also People detection and Family sharing!
Now my Wife can upload her photos too and we can share photos in the Family Album section. 

People detection doesn't seem to be quite as accurate as Google's implementation though, so it needs a way to 'untag' those that it gets wrong, I can't see a way to do that at the moment. 

-----------------------------------------

Very good service, really like the 'This Day' feature to remind of years past. 
For me, to improve the uploading of photos, I use the brilliant PhotoSync app. This gives me more 'fine' control over the process, like renaming photos with my preferred date format & choosing which folder to upload to, which is great for separating different devices. It also triggers auto uploading by setting locations. 
Would give 5* if some basic editing features were added.
title: Very good üòä

review: I‚Äôve looked at all the photo apps and all have monthly charges, I just wanted to back up my photo‚Äôs away from home automatically in case of fire/hardrive damage, I didn‚Äôt even plan to view the backup it was just for safekeeping. For under ¬£20 a year I get this and the app which now lets me look at pics I haven‚Äôt seen in years.. the face recognition is great as well.. ultimately (as I have prime anyway) this is amazing value and great functionality which is in addition to what I actually needed.
title: Ideal photo and video backup in case of fire/damage

review: Unlimited storage for your photos. Simple. How many people need to unload some storage from their phones? The app automatically syncs new photos, takes a few minutes if you do it once a fortnight. Not bad at all. The very first sync is time consuming, I had over 7000 photos, so can't complain about that. I really don't know why some people have given poor reviews here, seems like they can't use their phones and have blamed the app.
title: Brilliant app, recommend to everyone

review:
I have been worried about losing precious photos and videos for a while and had been looking at methods of how to store them. I have a hard drive back up but am always worried that this could fail. 
This App works seamlessly. I now have access to all my photos and videos wherever I am :-) 
Also happy to know I won‚Äôt lose precious memories because of a hard drive failure. It backs up whenever I take a photo or video. If I‚Äôd known about this App beforehand I needn‚Äôt have bothered buying a phone with so much storage.
title: Excellent

review:
This is a great little app which is free with prime, It has plenty of features like face recognition, filter by place etc, creating albums and sharing photos with people in the family vault. It also automatically backups all your photos when the app is open. 

My only issue is that when sharing holiday photos etc, it does not let you group them into an album in the family vault. So everyone ends up scrolling through a thousand photos to find the photos that they want.

Please implement albums in the family vault and this is 5*
title: Great Photo Storage

review:
The app generally works well and is very useful. There are however two problems I encounter with it. 

They are related. Every time I get a new phone or even sign out of the app it goes back over all the photos I have in iCloud (over 70,000 in my case) which seems to result in endless duplicates. I have as many as 5 copies of some photos. I am surprised the algorithm is unable to spot these duplicates. There is no easy way of removing them on either the desktop or mobile version and each has to be eliminated manually. I hope some automatic process can be included at some stage, even if it requires manual confirmation.
title: Good Apart From Duplicates

review: I love it. I honestly can‚Äôt get enough of it. It‚Äôs so easy to use and uploads all your photos and videos. It saves the ones you‚Äôve chosen as a favourite and keeps the in a folder separate but also in your main folder. Only this is that it struggles to upload Live Photo‚Äôs from your camera album. It saves them as a normal photos, which is fine because it doesn‚Äôt effect it, it just means you can‚Äôt see the short clip before and after. Apart from that, it‚Äôs amazing and I‚Äôm glad I found it.
title: Space saver

review:
I've had multiple external hard drives fail on me over the years, losing thousands of photos in the process.
I hadn't realised prime offers photo storage at full quality. I use this with my whole family and it's great to share a family vault where we can all upload our pictures, much better than sharing degraded quality photos over WhatsApp!
Nice touch that it can categorise by people, locations, AI recognition objects etc.
The app alone will ensure that I renew my Prime subscription!
title: An absolutely brilliant app

review: I just wanted an app to store my wildlife photos and just needed something clean and easy to use and this does the trick. Just using the free version but reckon I‚Äôll be happy to upgrade to fuller version through prime membership. I just like the simplicity of this app and speedy uploads where other services I have used seem to take forever. I‚Äôve only had it a short while but early impressions leave me wanting to rate highly
title: Quick clean and easy uploading

review: Easy to install, use and love the fact it automatically uploads my photos so I don‚Äôt have to worry about losing anything. My only wish is that all my videos would automatically upload, some of the videos on my phone uploaded but the storage facility for videos isn‚Äôt unlimited and seemed to max out quickly and now I can‚Äôt upload anything else, understand that you can‚Äôt have it all though, for photos the storage facility is unlimited so that‚Äôs amazing
title: Great for photos

It‚Äôs probably my age but finding one specific photo quickly isn‚Äôt as easy as it is on other photo apps. Having said that it‚Äôs excellent and included with Prime for ‚Äúfree‚Äù so I‚Äôm happy üòÉ
title: Great App

review: Wonderful to have photos all collected together from PC, iPad and phone and in some sort of order by year BUT I have too many duplicates and it will take hours to delete them. 5 stars.
userName: cant get a nickname wonder why

review:
It‚Äôs good for scrolling through photos, uploading etc.
It needs a smarter search functionality.
e.g. If I want to search for photos of batteries or shower heads etc it doesn‚Äôt really understand.
As a landlord, I need to be able to search for things by object name (battery, door handle, ceiling light, ADT sensor), or location that the photo was taken (e.g. North London rather than GPS or whatever. The current search fails to find most things unless it‚Äôs a face or date.
title: It‚Äôs good but searching could be better

review: Incredible value for money. Works better than Flickr (although taking unlimited photo storage as if it were the only benefit of Prime you might argue Flickr's rate for storing original quality images is better, but I trust Prime more, and with all the other benefits, this is basically 'free') and iCloud just gives me hassles. title: Better than just a 'benefit' of Prime Membership

review:
Free unlimited photo back up with prime membership is excellent. Limited video storage but cost of extra space is much cheaper than other cloud storage.

Prime actually saves each and every photo taken whereas others select which they save and which they don‚Äôt. (OneDrive)

Prime is great by itself for the shopping/postage side. The prime photos is and excellent and unexpected bonus.
title: Photo back up is an excellent feature.

  ‚ÄúAmazing deal, still needs functionality tweaks, for which I have faith in evolution. Basically the blueprint has been laid for something monumental here!‚Äù

 I find it fascinating and disappointing that a company with this much money can somehow hire developers who are this incompetent, this detached from their userbase, wow.

review: Hi
title: Hi

review: App now opens within seconds, manual or auto upload of photos, folders easy to create and access , just wish you could put an option in to view folders by full wall thumbnail for easy access as the scrolling sideways is a pain, trying to find a folder option by date might work for some however when you have many folders it would be easier to access from a thumbnail or icon pic rather than the option you have provided , anyways , I love the app, I'm sure through time it will deliver all my needs .
title: New Update Resolves Previous Issues

review: üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª
title: üëçüèªüëçüèª

review: P
title: Hi

review:
This is a great way to save space on my phone and the fact that the App saves the photos automatically makes life easy. The display of the photos in the App is excellent.
A couple of drawbacks -  i) it takes an age to upload the photos, and, ii) I have an iPhone and an iPad which share photos via Apple‚Äôs Photostream so the same photos appear on both but from a couple of weeks ago, when I choose ‚ÄúAll‚Äù in the App there are 2 copies of each photo - they do not seem to be identified as duplicates and there are 2 ‚ÄúAll Photos‚Äù albums in the Albums folder (presumably one for the iPhone and one for the iPad) which show the same photos - confusing and using double storage.
title: Great app but so slow

review:
Prime photos is a great photo and video storage and viewing app. My husband and I share an account, so can both see all our videos and photos (we have over 30,000 uploaded) and the photos taken with our phones and those we receive through WhatsApp and other messaging apps are automatically uploaded. 

We particularly like the "on this day" feature, which shows all the picture and photos from today's date in all years previous.
title: We love this app

review: I would have used this even if the app was bad being that it's unlimited free storage, so it's a bonus that the app is excellent. Great design, features and usability. I did have an issue where after a sync my latest photos wouldn't show up in the app but they were there when I checked via the browser so I didn't feel like knocking off a star for that especially since it's constantly updated so I am sure they'll sort it out soon.
title: Best cloud service for photo storage

review:
Love the app as a great place to store photos from multiple family devices, and see them everywhere. No restrictions and no extra fee on top of Prime. Love 'photos from this day' and look at them every day - reconnecting with photos from years ago. 

It would be great if it had a few more features like the Apple photos app - geographic searching in particular, and facial recognition. Could also be a bitter better at caching - sometime (even on fibre) spend much of time staring at a grey screen rather than photos.
title: Love it - could be even better

review:
This app was perfect before the update. 
I like the new, more modern look, however there are a few flaws! 
Hidden photos - not sure if I can't find it or they aren't there. You can no longer hide a photo and where I had some pics in the hidden photo bit, they are now gone. As this works seamlessly with my Fire TV I don't want all my photos there for all that use it to see! 
Secondly you can no longer search by year. When you have lots of pics on there, that was a really handy feature. 
Thirdly if you don't want to auto save, there is no manual way of adding pictures. Bit disappointed with this app now.
title: New update isn't good

review: What can I say? Unlimited storage of photos for free. No more loss of phone memory (for photos at least). The app itself is really smooth with a nice user interface. The latest addition of allowing you to select which photos to save is also brilliant meaning you don't have to go through and delete all the rubbish that you might stick on social media - instead just keep the memories you want. Top notch.
title: Great app

review: Prime must be pound for pound the best subscription service out there. Prime Photos certainly just backs up that theory: easy to use, free (for Prime users) and unlimited storage. Syncs with phone and therefore provides reassurance that your pics are housed in the cloud and available on any logged in device. Only issue that prevents 5 stars is sometimes the syncing gets a bit 'sticky' and needs a manual prompt to start so don't 100% trust it's always running in the background but otherwise it's a great app.
title: Another excellent component of the Prime service

review:
This app would be so good, because of the cheap storage it provides, if it wouldn't crash each 2-3 minutes and it wouldn't kill the battery. 10 minutes of uploading photos is using 10-15% of battery and making the phone very warm.

I'm giving it a trial run for 3 months... If it doesn't improve i'll go back to competition.

Update: dropped the rating to 1 star because it's NOT uploading all photos. Since the 20th of October it didn't upload anything and it's saying "no new photos". I have about 100 images/videos not uploaded in between. I'm starting the app couple of times a week, it's crashing over and over again. Iphone 6
title: Nice but...

review:
I've got thousands of photos on my old pc and hard drives, never thought I'd get them all together in one place!

This app is about as easy as it gets, just scroll through all the years gone by!

Very handy, once you've done your first upload (which took me nearly two days as I've got so many photos on the pc!) it auto uploads from my phone, so I never have to worry about backing up again!
title: Awesome!!!

review: As a prime customer for 6 years I was happy to find I could store all my photos without using memory on my phone. And included with my membership to prime. I take a lot of pics as I have a growing family and love looking back on how my kids are growing. I even digitized all the family photos belonging to my parents. Lots of data still available. I Love this app
title: Safe storage for my treasured pics

review: Brilliant app! Nice to know all the photos of our new son are safe and can be uploaded instantly with the automatic upload feature. It literally takes seconds - which is great if you dont have a lot of free time! I don't have to worry about losing my pictures if something happens to my phone anymore.
title: Brilliant

review:
I used to really like this app then they upgraded it and it is a real step backwards. 

I use the app to keep my phones memory free by uploading all my photos, this was really easy to do as it would tell you how many photos needed uploaded but now it doesn't tell you this. What was an easy task to see if all the photos on my phone were uploaded so I could then delete them has now become impossible. You also can't see which photos it is now uploading. 

The app also keeps displaying free up more space to speed up uploads, I have about 800mb free, not sure how much space it needs!?!?!
title: Was great then they updated it

review: This is a useful additional feature to the iPad. So far it hosts unlimited photos to subscribers and this is by far the best feature of them all. The app works well and is intuitive in use. Having the year selection toolbar on the right is super - if only it would remain out when I need it. So far this is the only improvement I can think will make a difference to use.
title: Great app but could be even better

review:
Well needed now uploads live photos but can't view yet. Seems faster and better upload progress display. However there's a bug where it always display around 10,000 items left to upload.. 

Overall good update but needs bug fixes and live photo viewing. üòÄ
title: Adds live photos upload and better upload progress display but bugs..

review: Love this app. So easy to get my pictures onto the cloud. As the parents of a one year old my wife and I take hundreds of photos. We get home and in a few swipes all our pictures are safe. Having tried other cloud apps before that were confusing and long-winded.
title: Keeping my daughter safe

review:
The last two updates have been bad since the introduction of Albums.  What was wrong with folders?  Now with the latest update, things are even worse.  There appears to be no way to access folders anymore.  At least the previous update still allowed that, but it was well hidden.  Even from the website it is now extremely difficult to gain access to them.   

The whole interface has taken a giant leap backwards in both appearance and usability!
title: With last update, it is now terrible!

review: With more updates, will be amazing. Really like the fact it's unlimited back up within my prime membership. Would agree with other comments regarding additional features such as full background sync, etc. As it is today-a great resource, looking forward to the next update.
title: Great app

review:
Amazingly friendly and nice GUI. Easy to search and quick uploads and downloads too. Nit crashing at all in my Iphone 6+ and 6( both 10.2 iOs)
3 stars rated becos 
- the album/folder arrangement is poor. There should be a MOVE/CUT command. 
-no HIDDEN/PRIVATE/locker facility for confidential data. Many clouds do have it.
title: No Locker/Private facility

review:
Cannot differentiate between pictures and movies, so uploads both even when you select 'photos only' option. It then places all in the pictures folder of the drive, again without sorting between photos and videos.

Other than this it is fairly easy to use, albeit it only has basic functionality.
title: Basic functionality, not intuitive

review: Really pleased with this app, I've upgraded and now pay for extra storage which is so handy. I can now delete pics off my phone yet still have them to view on the cloud. I have a few cloud apps and this is my favourite. BUT I wish I could edit the album names or change the order the albums appear in. Love it otherwise.
title: Good but...

review: It's a good app and unlimited photo storage through Prime membership is a good deal. I would like more space for video though as 5gb seems a bit of a contradiction when photos are unlimited. Also a bit annoying that you have to fire up the app to upload your pictures. It really needs to be doing that automatically to offer genuine peace of mind.
title: Needs background upload

review: This app is easy to use, I transfer photos to the app (cloud storage) every day, then delete them from my phone, saving a ton of space on my phone and still  can access my photos to show people via wifi or mobile data.
title: Fantastic app

review:
This App has become much much better now that Videos work as well. 
Before, it was in the App description but it never worked but now it does!!
Can't seem to be able to name individual though, although it's user friendly when you're logged in on the main website
title: Video Uploads work now

review: Works fine. My only gripe this far is that I have to open the app for it to update itself and download my latest photos. Something other, similar apps do. Can be irritating if I go to find a photo on my PC only to find they're still not uploaded from my phone.
title: Works well enough. No background auto-upload

review:
This app is getting better, but there is one important thing that has been requested numerous times, but is still being ignored by the developers.

We need the ability to turn off the "Memories from this day" feature, numerous users have complained about opening the app only to be confronted with the photo of a spouse/child/loved relative that has just died or some other emotional photo.

It needs fixing now.
title: Getting better, but...

review: Great for automatically saving photos. Only issue i have right now is that it still thinks it's January instead of February so my most recent photos appear in the wrong month. Minor issue since otherwise it just works and does the job.
title: Brilliant app

review: The app takes the pics direct from the photo album, which means it's easier to manage and delete ones taking up phone memory. Having unlimited is huge peace of mind and they're all divided into time and location frames. Seems to be just right so far, but it's early days!
title: Pleased so far

review: I updated this app automatically a couple of days ago and all I have got is terms and conditions and a redundant "get started" button. Pressing button gets nowhere I have somewhere in the region of 70gb of videos and photos on there I'm paying for storage and can't access by iPad and iPhone app. I am expecting early resolution to this and am very cheesed off to put it mildly. Very annoyed and unhappy customer hope this isn't politics between two American companies!!!!!!!
title: Completely knackered since update

review: Uploading all my photos couldn't have been easier! Quick and intuitive to use and accessible on every device.  Keeping folder structure would improve tablet and phone viewing.
title: Photo storage

review:
At the moment my only reference point is the awful app that came with the Seagate NAS I bought a few years ago.  As a prime member this was an added bonus for me and I am still uploading many thousands of photos to the drive.

Being able to get quick access to all my pictures will eventually be amazing and it's already proving useful. 

No doubt other will pick up on extra features it doesn't have, and it does seem slow to upload from my camera. but it's possible that I could do with uploading most of them via my computer to give my phone half a chance to to catch up.

All in all a "good".
title: Seems pretty good

review: I love the Prime photos app. I like that you can put them in folders very easily and set them as a screen saver on your tv etc or have a slideshow on your TV. I love it when it shows your photos each day from previous years. The only negative is that the photos can be quite slow to upload.
title: Great app

review:
I like it it is convenient and unlike the cloud I can see exactly which pictures I have.
I only have two bug bears it is needlessly tricky to download pictures to fi photo box to order prints. This may be due to my settings though. Since having my iPhone6 the phone doesn't always update which is tricky on holidays.
title: Nice but not as easy to get pictures back off

review: Love the feature that shows you photos from this day in previous years - it unearths photos you've forgotten about. Love how all my photos from all my different cameras are together in one place and I can view them anywhere - phone, iPad, PC, laptop, TV.
title: Great app!

review: I like that my photos are available on other devices and ready to upload to use with messages or Facebook. Nothing to do as they are instantly available. Highly recommend
title: So easy to use

review:
Last update fixed crash. Now working smoothly. Just need to add a few features common to many photo management apps and we are good.
Overall very good system. I use goodsync to keep everything tied together.
title: Back on track

review:
Love the app as saves space on my phone. I wish I could tag photos or people to make searching easier than just by date. Nice and fast though and auto loading is quick. 
What happens to the photos if a person dies though? Is there some sort of legacy download?
title: Great space saver

review: If you are a prime subscriber then this app allows you to store unlimited photo across you devices. Great for sharing with family. There are other alternatives but for personal sharing this App works efficiently. A nice little add on to prime membership.
title: Photo Share made easy

review: Easy to use, without all that annoying functions. And it can be up and running in less than 5 minutes! It used to cost hours to upload a 38G profile. Now it's only minutes. Amazing!
title: Amazing

review: By far the best storage for photos and videos! Even if you don't sort everything into albums your items are still easy to access (important to me so I can keep track of my lovely grandchildren)
title: Photo storage

review: I'm a prime subscriber and also have a fire stick. The app is great, take a picture on iPhone, open app and it gets backed up to cloud and after a few seconds it appears on the to via fire stick. It works great and saves a lot of space
title: Can't fault it.

review: Part of Prime membership is a large amount of free cloud storage space for photos, videos and other documents. This app is excellent in efficiently uploading photos and videos to Amazon's storage space. It's pretty easy to use, too.
title: Prime Members should use this app

review: Started as a very basic app but it is very quickly becoming a full featured photo management tool. The speed at which this app has improved is incredible. This is now my main photo backup service
title: Fantastic

review:
5Gb for video isn't enough, it would be good if there was some sort of AWS Glacier type of option for video. I may not want to view them all in real time but I do want to store them.
All in all though a no brainer for me, especially as a Prime user.
title: Great but.....

review:
My new all purpose photo app, saved all on October and this app, deleted all off camera roll to save +++ space. 
Please add 1 click option to choose specific photo for album cover!
Unlimited video would be great too!
title: So far ...Excellent

review: Good app that serves the purpose. It backs up the photos and with the latest updates there are easier options to create albums and look for specific photos.
title: It is constantly improving

review: Would be lost without this app love how shows memories of previous photos on the day of the year we're in! Plus being able to access them on any device. Wicked back up
title: Prime photos

review: I've been using this app for over a year now, used multiple devices during that time and never lost a pic. I love being able to see some family pics on the telly too. Fantastic app!
title: Fabulous

review: This is my favourite cloud based storage app. Photos easily upload in the background, then you can later view them on any device including Smart TV.
title: Great as a Photo album, easily accessed from any device

review:
I really love Prime as it save me a ton of money on delivery, and I've always liked the idea of unlimited free photo storage. The latest update promises that you can add family members but if you can it's not in this app. 

I'm wondering if family vault is only available in the US, and not the UK. Will increase to five stars once we get what the app promises in the UK App Store.
title: Update promises family

review: Must admit only use this because it is part of my Prime contract, but it is really useful. I don't take that many photographs I mainly use the camera for screenshots but I have linked this with my iPad so get the double safety aspect of backups on both systems.
title: Does the job

review:
Really like this app and having the ability to view all my photos.
Takes a bit of time to cache all of the pictures but worth it.
title: Great way to view photos in the cloud

review: Love being able to have my kindle fire hd pics on my iPad Air. Can't fault this at all and haven't experienced any of the problems others seem to be having. Very pleased with it and thoroughly recommend this app.
title: Excellent

review:
Absolutely amazing and quick.

No limit either at present I can see- great handy tool and searches for duplicates! Also has the option to create albums- definitely worth having with the Prime package!
title: Wow

review:
I was really pleased with this App when I downloaded it, but there are one or flaws which spoil the experience. 

Like other reviewers I've noticed that some photos are blurred when viewed. 

The App needs an upgrade to support the iPad natively. 

The Apps crashes out occasionally and needs to be restarted. 

Lastly I'd like an option to download folders of photos easily without having to install the program on my PC. I'm not allowed to install software on my work PC and so I'm prevented from downloading my photos unless I do this one by one which is tedious. 

Once the above are sorted its easily worth five stars.
title: Very good, but....

review:
Does what it's meant to 95% of the time.  Unlimited photo storage is a bonus as well.
Album use is easier than some other cloud storage. Occasionally get a photo that it refuses to upload if it's been modified and already exists, but can eventually get round that. Just a nuisance.
title: Good app

review:
Got this as part of my prime account, great way of having additional storage for free as part of the account.

Only wish it would update itself automatically rather having to do it manually all the time, if it did I could lose iCloud.

review:
The app is great if you want to backup only. Many simple features you'd expect from an app of this type are missing. 

1. Unable to tag photos individually or by batch.
2. Unable to sort by file name and/or tags within an album. Default sort is date modified putting many straight out of date taken order.
3. Ability to share whole albums.
4. Customise the slideshow by interval or transition.

Good for something used as an offshoot of having prime but very poor compared to other photo cloud products.

review:
The apple is a useful portal for uploading photos to use as a screen saver for my fire stick, but I wish it was easier. 

I process all of my photos in Lightroom, but I have to jump through several hoops to get them from Lightroom to Amazon photos, as the the only way to upload them is inside the app. 

If Amazon implemented a share sheet you could send images to Amazon photos from any enabled app

review:
1/. Open the app, and your photos & videos upload.

That‚Äôs it!
It‚Äôs that simple!

However, Amazon being as they are, will charge you extra for uploading all your videos, so you need to keep on top of your catalogue, and only keep the content you really want to save.

I use mine as a secondary backup to iCloud, in case of a cyber attack, but it‚Äôs good to know the photos and videos that really matter are safe.

Definitely recommend over Google One.

review:
I think this photo app is amazing.
I needed to back up my many thousands of photos on my mobile phone for many reasons.
I would be absolutely devastated if I lost any of the important ones.
This app is easy to install from the App Store and is incredibly easy to use.
The first use is the longest, depending on how many pics you have.
After that you can access the app daily like I do or how often you want to.
it will update any new photos or new videos you have taken since the previous upload.
I would definitely recommend Amazon Photos to anyone who needs to keep their photos safe in another place.
It gives me peace of mind.

review:
Amazon photos has one advantage over Google or Apple - it lets you view cloud photos without insisting on permissions to local photos or forcing synchronisation (I upload manually and don‚Äôt want automatic sync). That is where the advantages stop though. 

The interface for filtering is very poor with horizontal scrolling lists, there‚Äôs no map display, no use of embedded metadata (face regions, tags, titles, captions), and no details about a photo available - even when a face has been identified, it doesn‚Äôt show it in the image or info screen; even when a photo is geotagged, it doesn‚Äôt give you that information on the photo. It needs a lot of work to make this a useful repository for images. I wouldn‚Äôt pay for storage and use this as my primary photo cloud with the app in its current guise.
title: Bad interface, very poor metadata

review: This is in my opinion by far the best App for saving photos to the cloud. It is the fastest both to upload and download my photos drawn from and displayed on 5 separate Apple devices. Unlike Google photos which duplicates photos stored on the various devices, Amazon Photos only saves one copy and has never caused any problems whatsoever. Other useful elements of this app are that you can easily view the uploading progress in real time + it can be set to upload photos during the night. I long ago stopped using BT Cloud as it was fraught with problems which never got addressed or sorted despite constant referrals by users. I highly recommend this App

review:
I love Amazon photos. We have a couple of cloud storage systems for our numerous photos and videos ( google and iCloud )but Amazon is the best . 
The app is responsive , and intelligent and the search options once you have everything backed up are excellent. I have no bother finding specific places , people ( i did this online , with a VPN as europe won‚Äôt allow it ) , and things. Memories are wonderful . I also love the shuffle feature which i sometimes save as a collage. 
Keep up the good work guys. 
Only quibble is with the mobile version which is sluggish. iPad though spot on, 
Also love that once the items are backed up I can watch them on Amazon prime ( and set a folder for the screensaver ) on our Amazon fire tv box . 10/10.

review: Compared the various options for a family photo archive for my wife‚Äôs parents, which would allow sharing amongst their siblings, children and grandchildren, including a bunch of scans of old family photos from prior generations. Went with Amazon due to it being free with Prime and the ability to do the ‚ÄúFamily Vault‚Äú. Very happy with it so far, and my father in law seems pleased with it despite being sceptical of a web solution initially. Two suggestions for Amazon: (1) on the web interface, it would be nice if the menu of navigation buttons on the left (photos, family vault, albums, etc) stayed fixed in place as you scroll down the screen, because once you have a few thousand photos it is a pain to scroll back up to the top photos every time you want to navigate and (2) I wish there was a way to manually designate/tag a person even if they are not recognised as a person by the facial recognition AI (for instance if their face is turned away). But overall exactly what I was looking for.

A few months ago I went on a photography day out. Usually my phone backs up to iCloud overnight. That night there was an iOS update just before the back up kicked it. It messed up my phone and I lost all my pics. As soon as my phone was back up and running I downloaded the Amazon photos app. It‚Äôs a lifesaver. Now immediately after I take pics I open the app to back up my pics and I have peace of mind. 
A few minor niggles - we should be able to set it to be an automatic process
We need to keep the app open for photos to download. Running it in the background takes a long time 
Photos shot in live mode shouldn‚Äôt be classed as videos. 
The app doesn‚Äôt allow for as effective organising as logging in to the laptop version. The app should have the same capabilities.

review: Storing photos on the cloud is a good way to backup your photos. I have suffered the loss of years worth of memories in the past due to hard drive failure. The basic service is free with your Amazon Prime account but only offers a small amount of storage, which is OK for a few holiday snaps per year but if you take loads of Photos then you will want to upgrade your storage limit. The one big drawback with this service is that it only stores images in chronological order. Fine for many but if you are serious about your photography then it's a bit of a drawback. If you take thousands of Photos a year then you will tend to catalog your images into folders with meaningful names such as "Bob a Sue's wedding" and "day out in Bogner" for example which makes finding photos much easier than trying to remember the month and year of a photo you took 15 years ago. I know that my human brain remembers events better than dates. If yours is the same then you will probably wish to look elsewhere.
title: Let down by an inability to catalog

review: This app mostly works well, but the ‚ÄòMemories from...‚Äô feature does not! This part of the app is meant to show photos taken on this day in previous years. Annoyingly it will show photos from some years and not others. After two very long phone calls with Amazon, the best they could come up with was that the ‚ÄòMemories from...‚Äô feature was actually designed that way, and that it is not meant to bring up all photos from the date, just a random selection! Disappointing. Update: ‚ÄòOn This Day‚Äô seems to have disappeared from the UK iPhone Amazon Photos app. I‚Äôm baffled and quite annoyed about this. The feature was always flawed in that it didn‚Äôt show all the years I had photos for, only a random selection, but it was better than nothing. ‚ÄòOn This Day‚Äô was particularly useful because I have an Echo Show 8. I have that set up to show photos from this day in the past, and it was handy to be able to delete unwanted pictures on my phone before they were displayed in the kitchen! If anyone from Amazon actually reads this thread, please bring this feature back!!

title: Amazon photos

review:
This app used to have more functionality. I used the previous version to name people and it would also give me suggestions to add faces to a new person or add to an existing face. Not anymore. 
I could search for a name and it would find all the tagged photos with the name but now I have to look at a small tiny image of a person and hope I‚Äôve clicked the correct person. Some faces are similar to others and this makes it difficult. 
I have the Amazon desktop photos app. With the desktop app I can designate a folder on my pc with photos in and it will add them to the collection. Unlimited photos and raw images with a prime account. This is a useful pc backup of a photo album. I can download all the photos back to my pc if necessary. I have backed up over 3 terabytes and when I recently had a drive failure I managed to download everything back onto a new hard drive albeit with one major flaw that being that 2 years of iPhone photos were not downloaded to my pc. They are definitely on amazons cloud drive and if I log in to Amazon photos on a web browser all my photos including iPhone photos are there . Using windows 10 photos app and downloading all my photos from Amazon cloud to a pc for some reason doesn‚Äôt download iPhone photos. There is a way to get them using a browser but I can only select so many at a time and then they are zipped up. This is not exactly convenient. I‚Äôve been on the phone to Amazon technical help and as yet they have not resolved it. Searching the internet doesn‚Äôt resolve anything. I haven‚Äôt found any wizards on YouTube who even mention this annoying problem.
title: Search still missing and other annoyances.

review:
It is crystal clear that Amazon Photos doesn‚Äôt work well on the iPhone.
The app is feature poor and not really an alternative to Apple‚Äôs equally woeful Photos offering.
Despite uninstalling and reinstalling Amazon Photos several times (and other ‚Äòjumping through hoops‚Äô tricks like clearing the cache, the editing features simply do not save. I tried more than 70 times to rotate a photo through 90 degrees. No joy. After all this effort (several hours of my life I won‚Äôt get back) the photo is still balefully looking out at me, sideways. Hopeless.
It‚Äôs not even as if there is much richness to the app anyway. After a month of trial, it became clear that Amazon photos genuinely offers no alternative to Apple‚Äôs standard photos app anyway. Neither app provides a meaningful way to remove the multitude of informational photos we take on our phones but don‚Äôt want to see on our photos timeline. I‚Äôm probably not the only one who got Amazon Photos simply to be able to delete these off our Apple Photos film roll to use Amazon as a storage facility for these, but if you can‚Äôt rotate, crop or edit then what‚Äôs the point, eh?
No disrespect, Amazon, but you literally add nothing that isn‚Äôt already there with Apple. Both companies are fairly contemptuous of customers yet neither is smart enough to recognise there‚Äôs a demand from people willing to pay a premium to get away from the insipid basic free model.
So don‚Äôt worry too much Amazon: your app is not really much worse than Apple‚Äôs with the only exception being that there app works flawlessly and yours doesn‚Äôt.
title: Failing in iOS

review:
With the big visual change in the app that has happened within the past 12 months, family vault has not been giving enough consideration and it‚Äôs showing.

I have given feedback many times over the past 3 months for them to fix, many live chats, talking to people over the phone and actual leave feedback forms in the app itself. There‚Äôs just no communication and I think it‚Äôs because no one knows how to fix it so they‚Äôre sweeping it under the rug. Not a great experience btw.

Unlimited space is great sure, but when I‚Äôm trying to select specific photos to share with the family members in my family vault‚Ä¶here‚Äôs the things I‚Äôve experienced:

-Select photos then no actual option or button to put in the vault.
-Select photos and noticed there‚Äôs now an option in the ‚Äúdownload‚Äù symbol (that makes no sense?!)
-Select 30 photos and select ‚ÄúAdd to Family Vault‚Äù and the app crashes.
-Select 10 photos and select ‚ÄúAdd to Family Vault‚Äù have no clue if that has worked, so have to check on my phone to see if the photos have appeared.

Needs some serious work on certain bits. I‚Äôm posting a review about it now as I‚Äôve given Amazon enough chances to come back to me on this. I think 2 months waiting for a response is more than reasonable, don‚Äôt you?
title: Unlimited space is great, Family Vault is not fit for purpose.

review:
Please don‚Äôt waste your money if you plan on setting up some home cinema or speaker set. Single speakers it‚Äôs fine and will do the average person.
But I‚Äôve spent many hundreds and invested heavily on 2x 4th gen dots, 2x 3rd gen dots, 2x echo studios ¬£¬£¬£, 1 sub ¬£¬£¬£ and a fire 4K stick and a 4K max stick. Not to mention the extra fire stick light for the bedroom. 
I have a wifi 6 mesh system and 1 gbps FTTP broadband. I spent alot to get the ideal smart home as you could calculate. I wholeheartedly regret looking at Amazon for all this kit. I‚Äôm not naive in tech and quite savvy and I‚Äôve spent many many hours trying to get this all to sync and it just won‚Äôt have any of it. When I once did get it going it doesn‚Äôt last for long before it spits it‚Äôs dummy out somehow. Utter utter shambles! Buy yourself a dot or show and for any audio/film entertainment buy the equivalent sound bars and Bluetooth speakers. Also just to stick the boot in for the financial burden the chromecast 2020 is miles better and faster.
title: Buggy and waste of money be warned

I have always used iCloud to store my photos from my phone or camera so I was quite surprised when I received an email from Amazon offering free storage as a part of my Prime subscription.

All I will say is this, unlimited free storage for picture and a modest amount for video. Setting up is a breeze and backing up is very quick. 

Now I can view all my stuff online without any subs. This system beats flikr if you forget the social side of it.

If you have Prime, use the photo backup, you will not regret it.

review:
This app was working perfectly for a long time. I would manually upload photos from my phone and they would show up on my Amazon cube screensaver plugged into the tv. 

Today I was sitting in the living room, thankfully alone, and pictures of Christmas presents for my wife started showing up on the TV. For some unknown reason this app started automatically grabbing photos from my phone and uploading them to the cloud. I haven‚Äôt added any photos to the app in over a month so I know that I haven‚Äôt clicked on something by accident because I haven‚Äôt opened the app at all. They‚Äôve obviously updated the app recently because it looks very different from the last time I‚Äôve used it and buggered up a setting that makes it automatically update with my camera roll. Extremely disappointed with this. I promptly changed my tv screensaver to the default setting, removed all my photos and uninstalled the app. Not happy at all.

review:
So Amazon have decided to inflict an update on us to provide a new look and feel. Unfortunately it seems more time was spent redesigning the icon that implementing functionality. Features from the previous version have simply vanished as if they never existed (family vault - which incidentally still lives on in the redesigned web interface so what the people responsible for this feature are doing is Antibes guess), there‚Äôs also interface items which look like they should do something but are completely non-functional like a paper airplane icon at the top of the main screen which looks like it should be a button but it doesn‚Äôt do anything. I guess someone on the app team just really likes paper airplanes. 
Altogether this is an update that‚Äôs not brought anything new expect a slightly less intuitive interface, has dropped useful features and has added non-functioning UI elements for no reason at all.

review: Coming from Google Photos and being very used to that (but fleeing Google services over privacy concerns) I do miss a few features if I‚Äôm honest. Amazon photos doesn‚Äôt seem to backup new photos and videos in the background once they‚Äôve been taken - I have to open the app and then it takes a few seconds for it to realise, then back up and so on. Background handling could be improved. Also the ‚Äúfree up space‚Äù element where once things have been backed up it can delete the photos from your iOS camera roll (but obviously you still have to get rid of them from your deleted items too). Also the EXIF editing of date and time of items feels a bit clunky, like the UI element hasn‚Äôt been properly thought out.  Otherwise love this - the import process was slick and fast and it soaked up all my photos and videos with no issue at all.

review:
I really do like the overall interface and the ‚Äòthis time last year‚Äô feature but there are a few things that would make it better. 

‚Ä¢ The option to edit tags. My two children have been grouped together as they look very similar.
‚Ä¢ The option to remove tags. I have people tagged from the background of a picture who I don‚Äôt know, as well as characters from a backpack! 
‚Ä¢ (as a bonus!) I have also tried google photos and it has the option to delete backed up photos from a device. That way if my phone is full I am confident I am not deleting photos that haven‚Äôt been backed up and can keep freeing up space. 

The tagging issues have been flagged up by so many people so it really is time Amazon did something about it!!

Overall, as a prime member it really is a great app to have at a good price for storage.

We have a couple of Alexa‚Äôs and recently bought the echo show 8 which can be used as a digital frame essentially (which we already have one of in the front room and have loved it over the years) and our new Alexa is in the kitchen.
I downloaded Amazon Photos so all my pictures on my phone can upload into the app and then I created a separate folder specifically for using on the slideshow for the Alexa and there we are...I have a select few pictures on slideshow on my Alexa :)

I also like that it shows me, each day, pictures over the years on that day - like memories on Facebook! 

As a plus...it‚Äôs a back of all my pictures. Win win win.

review:
I recently discovered this app was not saving videos which is strange because we are frequently reminded that as prime members we have ‚Äúunlimited storage‚Äù, and let‚Äôs face it, you get the same with Google and Microsoft if you are members of their respective, and much cheaper, services, and they will tell you a video is only a large collection of photos anyway. 

But not to worry!  For just ¬£1.49 a month I can upgrade to 100GB!  So a quick check showed I have just 22GB of videos after 5 years and who cares about ¬£1.49 a month?  So obligingly I follow their instructions and upgrade. 

Only after the upgrade do I discover I no longer have unlimited storage and instead limited to 100GB, furthermore that does not include video storage. 

If it wasn‚Äôt so stupid it would be funny.  I mentioned it to a colleague of mine who works with Amazon's AWS services and he merely replied ‚ÄúIf there‚Äôs a way to make something complicated you can be sure Amazon will find it, unless of course they decide to go all the way and make it unusable too‚Äù.

I would check every regular payment you make to Amazon as it‚Äôs possible there will be a few you do not need‚Äù
title: Not good enough for Amazon

review:
I‚Äôve had photos stored on Amazon photo servers for some time all fine, hence 3*s. but I‚Äôve just got fire sticks for the kids for Christmas and while I know I can passcode protect the Amazon photos app on the fire sticks to keep the kids out of my backups, I‚Äôd rather there was nothing there at all for them to access. 
Silly me for thinking it would be as easy to get my photos off Amazon servers as it was to upload them in the first place. I imagined there would be a one click ‚Äúremove all photos and videos‚Äù option with a further ‚Äúare you sure?‚Äù One click Option. 
No. I had the option of selecting groups of photos based on upload date, a few at a time or by date the photo was taken. A lot of clicks to remove several thousand photos that I‚Äôd backed up. 

Great unlimited photo storage, not so great if you want to withdraw consent for Amazon servers to hold your personal photos.

review:
As an app I would say it‚Äôs nowhere near as good or feature rich as Apple photos however I like the fact that it‚Äôs backed by a raw file-system so I can organise my photos into folders and know that I can easily get them out should I want to. 

That said Amazon have just told me that they‚Äôre stopping support for syncing Synology NAS to Amazon Drive so this completely breaks my workflow.  As a result I‚Äôm going back to Apple photos and will just use a simple bit of AppleScript to do a weekly export to back-up to my NAS. 

Bit by bit I feel that Amazon are chipping away at the usefulness of Prime Membership so I‚Äôm starting to question whether to continue with it, particularly as I increasingly feel I don‚Äôt trust a lot of the sellers on Amazon as to whether their goods are genuine or conform to UK safety standards.

review: Really handy app and great free photo storage.  Couple of niggles; firstly the amount of small video clips people save on their phones these days means the storage Amazon give you for video isn‚Äôt enough.  Secondly, when pulling photos from various devices together this inevitably results in duplicated uploads of the same picture.  There really should be some way for the software to suggest duplicated photos and support you deleting them.  I have uploaded 85k photos and hazard a guess that 5k are duplicated - massive manual job that could be made so much simpler with some simple software tweaks.  Lastly it‚Äôs annoying that it will only upload from your phone when you have the app open - it won‚Äôt do it in the background and the night sync isn‚Äôt great as it is still leaving your screen on all night (even if it shades it black).  Be good to be able to share wider than family - different folders with different groups.  Those niggles aside a pretty handy app

review:
This app does what it sets out to do, it allows upload and viewing of images to amazon cloud storage. However there is clearly so much potential functionality not used. There are many other similar apps for handling photos, some such as picasa have been around for years, yet they have far more functionality than amazons efforts. I really hope amazon choose to build on the capabilities of this app.
Some specific gripes are lack of folder functionality, once loaded only the date taken is really a sortable criterial. No preservation of folder structures. For a few dozen photos that‚Äôs not an issue, but if you have tens of thousands uploaded from various sources, often with date errors, it is a nightmare. In effect the app becomes a random photo server. Good luck finding that specific image from a few years ago.
Well as I say, a good start with plenty of scope for improvement.
title: Good start, but so much more potential

review: All photos stored, no need to pay for i cloud as this is part of my Amazon Prime service. Excellent.
title: Brilliant

review:
A fantastic app that I use to manage backups of photos from my phone & interchangeable lens camera.

My favourite things include:

- backed up RAW photos from my Sony A6xxx all show as previews, so there‚Äôs no need to keep old photos or .jpeg copies on my pc just so I can see a thumbnail 

- unlimited use for most of the image formats I use, with an Amazon Prime membership

- creates a searchable database of people, places & objects (seems to vary depending on image format)

- I find it very easy to use

Some things I would like to further improve:

- RAW photo previews do not show in camera adjustments, so the preview & downloaded copy don‚Äôt necessarily colour match (this may be dependant on camera)

- Does not seem to search RAW images for people objects

- Would love support for .insp files (360 camera images), including showing a preview of the file, and having as part of the unlimited use 

- Would love my Affinity Photo image edits to be included in the unlimited use

- There is a built in image editor but doesn‚Äôt support edits to RAW files (eg it would be nice to do basic corrections and save as a .jpeg or .png etc)

- For the paid storage plan (on top of Amazon Prime membership) I would like a 200gb a year option competitive with Apples offering on iCloud, with the option to pay monthly not yearly

review:
The ability to store RAW files is terrific and the interface is simple to use.

However it is frustrating in one respect in that i have edited most of my stored images in Lightroom, so each RAW file has a DNG sidecar file, with the edits stored in it. 

I cannot select the file types to sync/upload so cannot ignore .DNG - so I now have a library with thousands of ‚Äúbroken‚Äù .DNG files showing in the preview.

I would either like to prevent Amazon Photos uploading sidecar files by ignoring, in my case, .DNG or, preferably, hide these and other broken files from preview.

Put this right and clean up my preview pages and you can have 5 stars!

review:
So I‚Äôve named everyone I want to under the ‚Äòfaces‚Äô area but the app picks up on other people in the photo (strangers in the background) and shows their face too. 

There is no way to hide individual unwanted faces. The only option is to hide the ENTIRE photo which is useless for this purpose. 

I‚Äôve been using this app since day one and I‚Äôve been very pleased (and grateful) with every new release and have looked forward to each update to see what new features have been added.

Unfortunately, the fact that I can‚Äôt hide unwanted people (faces) and have to look at dozens of unknown strangers and objects like statue heads while browsing is very annoying. Couple this with this the storage-cap on video uploads plus a few other niggles and ‚Äòwants‚Äômakes this app my second choice. There‚Äôs a long way to go before I would feel confident and happy to move from Google Photos to Amazon Photos.

review:
After reading up on storage options for my ever expanding photo collection I came across this one and the reviews made it sound amazing! I signed up and all was great, I had my unlimited storage.
Little did I know it was a trial and that come April, the app would tell me I‚Äôd exceeded my quota of 5gb and I‚Äôd have to delete some photos before I could continue backing them up.
Several emails later I discovered it‚Äôs because it‚Äôs my husband that is the main prime customer and not me, I‚Äôm only an invitee. This is fine, I understand, but what I don‚Äôt understand is why Amazon didn‚Äôt inform me it was only a trial and make this clearer in their terms and also what‚Äôs the point in me backing up all my photos, removing them from my phone to then be told I have to delete them from the drive?! Kind of defeats the object of having somewhere to back them up... not impressed

review: My second review of the new update , the first wasn't good. I upload most of my photos to Amazon cloud on my MacBook as albums . I was frustrated with the new update as when I wanted to view/download them on my iPhone they were not in albums so I had to manually put them in albums to keep them organised the way I like it. What I didn't realise is that the web version of Amazon photo had been updated and you can actually upload your photos as albums that will show up in the iPhone / iPad app. I was using the All Files tab instead of the Photos/Videos tab on the website to make albums as I've always done and this no longer works so just click on the Photos/Videos tab to make an album and upload from there. Hope this helps

review:
*Latest version update*
Still no ability to manually update your photos!! Still basically useless. No programmers can be this rubbish, so it seems obvious to me that Amazon have decided that the business model to allow us to upload our entire photo collection no longer works. They should be honest about it. 
******
Unlike some other reviewers on here, the app opens without issue. Also I can jump to any year/month I like using the side bar (click the weird blue arrows at the top right). I stumbled upon that feature as it's no where near obvious. 
However, the app is totally ruined as there is no option to upload existing photos. It seems it only uploads from the camera roll.  As voiced by others this is essentially no longer a photo management app. 

One of the reasons I signed up for Prime was the unlimited photo storage. I was in the process of uploading  all my albums. It now seems that's not possible.
Unbelievable that an app from Amazon could be so rubbish, when it had been so good. 
Please sort it out.

review: Too slow on the mobile networks but that is the fault of the network. With wifi, it works very well indeed and is a great way of sharing photos with friends and family. Also, friends recently suffered a burglary in which their laptops and effectively all of the photos they hadn't yet backed up were lost. They now use Amazon photos as a backup system secure from thieves.
title: Amazon Photos

review:
I've been looking for a photo back up app which allows me to SELECT what photos to upload. The Amazon app is the only one I have found that does this without insisting on uploading my entire photo library. This is a great feature and I hope Amazon don't change this behaviour.

I'm glad to see Amazon listening to feedback and adding albums. The integration of which is similar to how the photos app works on iOS with a main 'all photos' with virtual links to each photo when placed in an album. I would perfect to have a more traditional file system where I can place photos where and how I want without this virtual link. However as this is how ever other photo app works I'll accept this behaviour as its a more defined separation in the app compared to photos in iOS.

I think the app still needs further polish, such as better sorting in albums, but it's still the only photo app I can find which doesn't insist on uploading your entire photo library.

As a prime customer this app has enabled me to move a selection of my family photos from Dropbox / IOS Photos into amazons cloud for free. I always hated giving my iPhone to people to look at family photos as I had many work photos in my photo stream, now they are all in Amazon photos. For this I'm glad Amazon made this app. Please keep developing it.
title: Simple yet effective

review:
All digital photos contain embedded metadata showing the precise time and date a photo was taken. This means that photos in albums can only be sorted by reference to this data. 

What if you want to arrange photos in an album in a different order - by place, subject, people for example. It is easy to rename photos to put them in whatever order you want. But Amazon Photo, unlike other cloud drives, does not allow sorting by name. 

Why not. Sorting only by date is a very inflexible system. (The same problem exists in the Folders which underpin the albums. Even if you rename the photos to the order you want Amazon Photo insists on sorting them by date.)
title: Sorting by newest or oldest not sufficient

title: Upload in the background

review:
Please be aware I am a Prime member, so your experience may differ to my own.

This is by far the best photo storage app I've ever used. It uses simple tools to upload, download and share your photographs, and if you don't want to upload your entire catalogue, Amazon Photos allows you to choose specific photographs to upload. And, much to my joy, it lets you know which photographs are being uploaded at any given point - iCloud take note! The process is fast and simple, with a beautiful layout that's mirrored across iPhone, IPad and Fire TV (if you have it). 

If I had one criticism it would be the lack of an editing tool, something which is featured on Flickr and Apple Photos. Currently I have to re-download from Amazon into my library and then edit it. This is a small hindrance to me, but those more savvy than I may find it a deal breaker. 

Overall Amazon Photos is a fantastic app, and when coupled with Amazon Cloud Drive, it solves all of my storage needs.

Other angry reviews seem to suggest that this  is resulting in hundreds / thousands of duplicate images and videos.  I haven't given it a chance to find out.  I have completely disabled auto-sync until Amazon sort this out.  So this current version is completely unless :(   Please correct this new feature somehow Amazon!!!

review:
I suppose these will be addressed in due course?:

20minute limitation on videos?! What's the difference between two 19minute and one 38 minute video - hassle.

My MP4s are often resized and aspect ratio changes

Upload is slow ~500kbps average, so unlimited means throttled-unlimited.

(Chrome) uploads full file before noticing it's already there - then stalls until you check they are the same size and allow it to skip overwrite.

(Amazon cloud drive client) can't control the path of the uploads online! So if you have multiple sources you are uploading from you cannot merge the uploads neatly.

Nice-ish
